did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies records,1974-1986.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies (U. S.).

did.physdesc: Printed Materials, Publications, Reports, Research Materials
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Reports and legislation briefs, policy agendas, reports, and briefs. Subjects include women's issues, family farms, tax reform, community energy planning, local food, plant closings, cooperatives, South African divestment, toxic chemicals, and health care.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Reports and legislation briefs, policy agendas, reports, and briefs. Subjects include women's issues, family farms, tax reform, community energy planning, local food, plant closings, cooperatives, South African divestment, toxic chemicals, and health care.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies (U. S.).

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies records, #6756. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIAL
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies digital collection, which consists of digitized readers from the physical collection, as well as additional material.
See also: Progressive Cities and Neighborhood Planning Collection, #15-2-3414

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Forms part of the Progressive Cities and Neighborhood Planning Collection.

did.unittitle: Bernard, Sherman. The Manitoba Auto Insurance Plan. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Public Policies, 1971.

scopecontent.p: Descriptions of economic and social effects of the Manitoba Auto Insurance Plan.

did.unittitle: Webb, Lee (Ed.). Protecting the Family Farm/Preserving Farm Land. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, ca. 1975.

scopecontent.p: Report on detrimental policies toward farms - policy descriptions, articles, and analysis.

did.unittitle: Simison, Robert. The Activist. Cleveland: Committee for New Political Initiatives, 1975.

scopecontent.p: Newsletter: How to Rip-off the Federal Government Legally, briefs of actions in various states.

did.unittitle: Rhodes, Kathy. Legislative Handbook on Women's Issues. Washington D.C.: Institute for Policy Studies - Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1976.

scopecontent.p: A Collection of Legislation on Economic Issues Affecting Women. Scenarios, legislation, and implementation steps in specific cities.

did.unittitle: Rowe, Jonathan;Beaudry, Ann (Ed.). New Directions in State & Local Tax Reform. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Public Policies, 1977.

scopecontent.p: Articles and arguments for tax reform.

did.unittitle: [no author provided] [various titles]. Washington D.C.: Women Today, 1977.

scopecontent.p: Many summaries of recent actions concerning social equality.

did.unittitle: Kelly, Edward. Industrial Exodus: Public Strategies for Control of Corporate Relocation. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1977.

scopecontent.p: Study of the transfer of business overseas; suggestions for maintaining economic strength in the states.

did.unittitle: Grune, Joy Ann (Ed.). Manual on Pay Equity: Raising Wages for Women's Work. Washington D.C.: Conference on State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Report on women's work experience in several different categories of the economy. Ideas for changes.

did.unittitle: Leibig, Michael. Social Investments and the Law - The Case for Alternative Investments. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: Studies in Pension Fund Investments 3 - Explorations of "The Law of Social Prudence" and investment strategies.

did.unittitle: Freedburg, Michael; Hughes,Ken. Meeting Local Needs: Resources for Self-Sufficiency. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Community Skills and Resources - The Energy Project Report 3. Agencies and organizations that would contribute to sustaining CBOs.

did.unittitle: Brasuk, Danny; Glass, Becky; Mode, Suzanne. Local Alternative Energy Futures - Perspectives and Resources. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Conference Proceedings December 11-13, 1980, Austin Texas.

did.unittitle: Dawson, Steve. Worker Cooperatives and the National Consumer Cooperative Bank Act. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies - Industrial Cooperative Association, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Outlines and summaries of worker cooperative organization and association with the NCCB.

did.unittitle: [no author provided] Innovative Energy Projects: A Briefing Book. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Community Skills and Resources - The Energy Project Report 4. Agencies and organizations that would contribute to sustaining CBOs.

did.unittitle: Hyde, Henry; Kennedy, Maggie. New Initiatives in Farm, Land and Food Legislation - A State-by-State Guide: 1979-1980. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1979 - 80.

scopecontent.p: Descriptions of new legislation for each state.

did.unittitle: Slavet, Julie. Energy Conservation - Resources. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: Lists of resources used for the Energy Project.

did.unittitle: Gordon, Erika; Logan, Patricia. The National Consumer Cooperative Bank: The First Year. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Analysis of Policies and Recommended Changes for the Cooperative Bank. NCCB Monitoring Report 1.

did.unittitle: Gordon, Erika; Logan, Patricia. The National Consumer Cooperative Bank: The First Year - Portfolio Analysis and Loan Recipient Survey. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: NCCB Monitoring Report 2

did.unittitle: Triplett, Thomas J.. Investing in Minnesota: A Proposal to Use State Moneys for Maximum Benefit. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: Studies in Pension Fund Investments 4.

did.unittitle: Smith, David. The Public Balance Sheet: A New Tool for Evaluating Economic Choices. Washington D.C. Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Public Policy report on economic development.

did.unittitle: Hughes, Ken; Pape, Barbara. Citizen Involvement in Community Energy Planning. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Community Skills and Resources, Report 5. The Energy Project.

did.unittitle: Okagaki, Alan. State and Local Solar Energy Policy: Meeting Low-Income Needs. Washington D.C.: The Energy Project, Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Public Policy Report- Descriptions of the effects of energy policy on low-income residents; some alternative state policy descriptions.

did.unittitle: Spielberg, Fred; Zinner, David. Portfolio Analysis and Loan Recipient Survey. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: The National Consumer Cooperative Bank: The First Year. Co-op Develoment and Assistance Project.

did.unittitle: Scully, Michael. Massachusetts Public Land for Farms and Gardens - Innovative Legislation Series. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Legislation brief from the Agriculture Project.

did.unittitle: Scully, Michael. Massachusetts Institutional Purchase of Local Food - Innovative Legislation Series. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Legislation brief from the Agriculture Project.

did.unittitle: Scully, Michael. Interstate Grain Marketing Compact - Innovative Legislation Series. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Legislation brief from the Agriculture Project.

did.unittitle: Kelly, Edward. Plant Closings - Resources for Public Officials, Trade Unionists & Community Leaders. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: State-specific reports on reactions to major plant closings. A call for plant closing legislation.

did.unittitle: Schweke, William (Ed.). Plant Closings - Issues, Politics, and Legislation. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: Briefing Book, Economic Development Project. Tables, legislation descriptions, and analyses of the effects of plant closings.

did.unittitle: Webb, Lee (Ed.). Economic Development: New Ideas for the Midwest - Agenda '85. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: Articles, summaries, analyses of policy ideas.

did.unittitle: [no author provided] Economic Development: New Ideas for the Missouri. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: Articles, summaries, analyses of policy ideas.

did.unittitle: Kennedy, Maggie; Sherman, Jay. New Directions in Farm, Land and Food Policies: Legislative Update 1979. The Agriculture Project. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Lists of legislation pieces in different states.

did.unittitle: Schweke, William. Natural Resource Taxation - Perspectives, Resources & Issues. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: Briefing Book, Economic Development Project. Collection of articles.

did.unittitle: Various authors. California Farmworker Displacement Bill - Innovative Legislation Series. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Legislation brief from the Agriculture Project.

scopecontent.p: Legislation brief from the Agriculture Project.

scopecontent.p: Collection of articles during the Kucinich years.

scopecontent.p: Studies in Pension Fund Investments 10. Community Economics, Inc. Proposals.

scopecontent.p: Descriptions of new legislation for each state.

scopecontent.p: Studies in Pension Fund Investments 5, Center for Economic Studies.

scopecontent.p: Descriptions of programs and ideas for energy initiatives.

scopecontent.p: Summaries of proposed and written legislation for changed economic opportunity.

scopecontent.p: Informative booklet describing the toxic problems in an area of Philadelphia, ideas for regulation, and proposals for legislation.

scopecontent.p: Pamphlet on cooperatives' role in saving energy.

scopecontent.p: The Energy Project and The Coop Bank Project

scopecontent.p: Studies in Pension Fund Investments 5, Center for Economic Studies.

scopecontent.p: Policy memo

did.unittitle: Messinger, Ruth. Economic Development: An Agenda for the Cities. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: Model Agenda: memo suggesting a new public policy initiative prepared for public officials, policy analysts, and civic leaders

did.unittitle: Webb, Lee. State and Local Tax Reform: An Agenda for States and Cities. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1982.

scopecontent.p: Model Agenda on a critical public policy issue prepared for public officias, civic leaders and activists

did.unittitle: Rosen, Corey. Employee Ownership: Issues, Resources and Legislation - A Handbook for Employees 7 Public Officials. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Model Agenda on a critical public policy issue prepared for public officias, civic leaders and activists

scopecontent.p: Model Agenda on a critical public policy issue prepared for public officials, civic leaders and activists

did.unittitle: Del Giudice, Marguerite. Anniversary of the fight for 9 to 5 women. Boston: Boston Sunday Globe, Organization for Women Office Workers, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Photocopied newspaper article on a convention for working women.

did.unittitle: Timchick, Mary. Women stress organizing as economic key. Cleveland: Cleveland Press, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Photocopied newspaper article on women's organizations.

did.unittitle: [no author provided] Farm, Food, Land. Nashville, TN: Agricultural Marketing Project, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Excerpt from newspaper with various agriculture-related articles.

did.unittitle: [no author provided] Fair and Conference on the Mall, Washington D.C. Washington D.C.: Act 79, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Program guide to a conference on renewing resources, sustainability, and best-practice methods.

did.unittitle: Various authors. Coop Bank Conferences. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Folder of conference materials.

did.unittitle: Various authors. Cooperatives and Energy - New Coops and The National Consumer Coop Bank. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: The Energy Project and The Coop Bank Project

did.unittitle: Cooperatives & Energy: Annotated Bibliography and Resource Directory. Washington, D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: The Co-op Development and Assistance Project, The Energy Project - bibliography and contact info.

did.unittitle: Various authors. Various Working Papers and Publications, Annotated Bibliographies. Wellesley: Center for Research on Women, 1979.

scopecontent.p: Collection of bibliographies

did.unittitle: Various authors. Various Conference Materials and Publications by the National Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies

scopecontent.p: Collection of documents

did.unittitle: Beaudry, Ann. Letter to Doyle Niemann

scopecontent.p: Letter about a "Women in the Economy" Conference in Cleveland.

did.unittitle: [no author provided] City accused on longtime job bias. Cleveland: Sunday Plain Dealer, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Newspaper article describing the racial and sexual discrimination against a woman in Cleveland.

did.unittitle: Various authors. [various titles]. New York: Newlestter of The Democratic Left, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Newsletter
Publication focusing on women's issues and movements.

did.unittitle: Beaudry, Ann. Women in the Economy: Policies and Strategies for Change. Washington D.C.: The Executive Female Digest, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Brief description of a meeting on women's economic experiences sponsored by the Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies.

did.unittitle: Various Authors. Updates on State Initiatives

scopecontent.p: Collection of handwritten notes attached to articles, memos, and reports: Tax Reform in Ohio, Family Planning in Maryland, Environmental Initiatives in California, Weapons and War in Minnesota, Taxes and Revenue in Washington D.C., Lifeline Services In Washington D.C., Housing in New York, Economic Conversion in Minnesota, Environment in New York, Recycling in Illinois. Contact Information provided

did.unittitle: Baker, Lawrence; Bluestone, Barry; Harrison, Bennett . Corporate Flight - The Causes and Consequences of Economic Dislocation. Washington D.C.: Progressive Alliance, National Center for Policy Alternatives, Working Papers for a New Society, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Analytical book

did.unittitle: Hartman, Chester. Letter to Lee Webb

scopecontent.p: Letter about the Planner's Netwokr; update on projects and people.

did.unittitle: Gautier, Duane. Meeting Local Needs: Technical Resources for Self-Sufficiency. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Community Skills and Resources - The Energy Project. Agencies and organizations that would contribute to sustaining CBOs.

did.unittitle: Hughes, Ken; Pape, Barbara. Innovative Energy Projects: Models for Self-Sufficiency. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: Community Skills and Resources, The Energy Project. Assessments and Plans for Community Participation in saving energy.

did.unittitle: The Coop Bank: New Funds for Community Development: Washington D.C.: Conference/Alternative State & Local Policies, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Section-by-section summary of the Coop Bank Act

did.unittitle: Peirce, Neal R. & Hagstrom, Jerry. Watch Out, New Right, Here Come the 'Young Progressives'- National Journal Political Report. Washington D.C.: Conference/Alternative State & Local Policies, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Article w/ description of the ideals of the upcoming social activists such as philosophy, conference activities, initiatives & groups

did.unittitle: Kieschnick, Michael & Katzmann, Lynne S.. Policy Memo- 1981 & 1983 Memorandums. Washington D.C: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: 2 legislation memorandums- #1: Developing A State Venture Capital Strategy (Kieschnick, May10, 1981). #2: A Pro-Competitive Model for a Statewide Health Insurance Program: The Oregon Proposal (Katzmann, January, 1983)

did.unittitle: Schweke, William & Webb, Lee. Putting America Back To Work: What States & Cities Can Do: Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1982.

scopecontent.p: Documented summary of employment issues in the U.S.- 4 sections including new work strategies, access to employment for the disadvantaged, assisting the unemployed, worker rights; organizational resources: 74 pages

did.unittitle: Logan, Patricia (Ed.). Community Energy Cooperatives: How to Organize, Manage and Finance Them- An Organizer's Handbook. Washington D.C.: Co-op Development & Assistance Project Energy Project. Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies. Revised Edition, 1982.

scopecontent.p: Revised edition from 1980 Original print. Documented summary for alternatives to the energy crisis- 8 sections including problems, cooperatives, case studies, organizing, finance, business planning, plus Appendix A-E & glossary: 229 pages

did.unittitle: Leibig, Michael. Mandating Social Prudence: A Handbook for Pension Investment- Studies in Pension Fund Investment 12. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1982.

scopecontent.p: Documented summary of Pension Investment issues- 4 sections including pension plan creation, regulation, implementation, & administration, plus intro & conclusion, and Appendix A-B: 99 pages

did.unittitle: Moore, Nancy. The National Consumer Cooperative Bank: Eligibility: How Co-ops and Community Organizations Can Use The Co-op Bank- NCCB Monitoring Report 4: Co-op Development And Assistance Project. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternatives State & Local Policies, 1982.

scopecontent.p: Manual providing step-by-step info regarding eligibility for fund from the NCCB- 5 sections plus Appendix and 6 Exhibits: 56 pages

did.unittitle: Conference Reports. Wisconsin: Alternative State & Local Policies, 1975.

scopecontent.p: 2 conference reports- #1: Where Do We Go From Here?...Conference Report. 13/14/15 June 1975. Madison, Wisconsin (Report prepared by Barbara Bick). #2: Southwest Regional Conference. Dec.5-7, 1975.

did.unittitle: Webb, Lee. State Bank for Coops: A Proposal to Establish a State Bank for Cooperatives and a State Cooperative Development Agency. Washington D.C.: Institute for Policy Studies, 1975.

scopecontent.p: Policy review proposal. 6 sections including cooperative approach to employment & economic development, cooperatives today, opportunities for creation & expansion, history of government efforts, assistance needed, conclusion & recommendations, plus footnotes & bibliography. Proposal prepared for the Department of Employment Development of the State of California

did.unittitle: Jones, David & Webb, Lee (Ed.). America's Cities and Countries: A Citizens Agenda. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: Book with 11 sections for each policy issues plus list of contributors

did.unittitle: Newman, Sandy & Jones, David with Lizzaralde, Carlos. Model Agenda. Voter Registration: An Agenda for the States. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: "A model agenda on a critical public policy issue prepared for public officials, civic leaders and activists" - 8 pages

did.unittitle: Freedberg, Michael & Hatfield, Anne. Financing Energy Conservation: What States and Cities Can Do. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: 4 chapters including public & private sources of funds, financing vehicles, loan structures, plus glossary and resource list

did.unittitle: Jones, David & Webb, Lee (Ed.). America's States: A Citizens Agenda 1983-84. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: Book with 10 sections for each policy issues plus liste of contributors

did.unittitle: Bohannon, Mark & Buckley, Mary & Osborne, David. The New Right In The States: The Groups, The Issues, And The Strategies. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1984.

scopecontent.p: 6 sections including what is the new right, its organizations, future directions, challenges, and appendices

did.unittitle: Tryens, Jeffrey (Compiled by). Toxic Substances: New Ideas for the Midwest, Agenda '85. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1984.

scopecontent.p: Chicago: various legislations/act compiled with data and other info

did.unittitle: Martin, Sandra. The New Right's Education Agenda for the States: A Legislator's Briefing Book. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: 5 chapters including "the alec approach to education", what legislators need to know, "parent's role in education", "teacher's role in education", "state's role in education", plus appendices

did.unittitle: Sherry, Susan. High Tech and Toxics: A Guide for Local Communities. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: 469 page book with 7 chapters including high technology, facing the problem, health hazards, opportunities for local government, etc., plus appendices

did.unittitle: Various authors. Women in the Economy: Equity for Farm Women - Proposals for Estate Tax Reform. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1978.

scopecontent.p: Policy report on women farmers which includes policy reviews, reforms and newspaper articles
4 sections including: the problem, war between the states, citizen/labor mobilization, Ohio case study

did.unittitle: 1979 Annual Report: The Agriculture Project. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: 6 sections including: history & goals, highlights of project activities, conference & workshops, publications, staff, steering committee, plus appendiz

did.unittitle: Coltman, Edward & Metzenbaum, Shelley. Investing in Ourselves: Strategies for Massachusetts - Studies in Pension Fund Investments 1. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: A report of 6 chapters plus appendix A-E including: intro, objectives, alternatives, checklist of actions, investor strategies, resources & proposed legislation

did.unittitle: Redirecting Public Funds: A Strategy for the City of Berkley - Studies in Pension Fund Investments 9. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: "A report of the Citizens Committee on Responsible Investments". 8 sections including: intro, summary of recommendations, promoting indirect benefits to Berkley from investments, investment vehicles, cooperation w/ other investors, etc., plus appendices A-H

did.unittitle: Schur, Robert & Phelan, Marilyn. The Housing Crisis: A Strategy for Public Pension Funds - Studies in Pension Fund Investements 11. Washigton D.C.: Conference on Alternatives State & Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: 7 sections including: diagnosis of the problem, pension fund transfusion, treating the patient, alternatives, etc., plus notes

did.unittitle: Rosen, Corey. Employee Ownership: Issues, Resources and Legislation - A Handbook for Employees & Public Officials. Washington D.C.: National Center for Employee Ownership & the Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1982.

scopecontent.p: 8 sections including: executive summary, intro, employee ownership models, employee-owned companies, obstacles to expanding employee ownership, federal programs, roles for state & local governments, plus footnotes & appendices

did.unittitle: Freedberg, Louis. America's Poisoned Playgrounds: Children and Toxic Chemicals. Washington D.C.: Youth News & Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: 8 chapters including: overview & major findings, "Inner City Canaries", pesticides, freeway parks, etc., and resources for action

did.unittitle: Goldberg, Lenny. Building Cooperatives in California: A Model for State Action. California Cooperative Federation and Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: 4 chapters including: co-op history in CA, consumer goods & services cooperatives, housing cooperatives and worker cooperatives, plus appendix A -D

did.unittitle: Tryens, Jeffrey (Ed.). The Toxics Crisis: What States Should Do. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1983.

scopecontent.p: 6 sections including: intro, protecting workers, protecting the community, waste disposal waste clean-up, plus list of contributors and end notes

did.unittitle: Tarr-Whelean, Linda (Ed.). A Women's Rights Agenda for the States. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1984.

scopecontent.p: 5 sections including: intro, employment & economic issues, human services & education, political & human rights, plus list of contributors

did.unittitle: Webb, Lee & Tryens, Jeffrey (Ed.). An Environmental Agenda for the States. Washigton D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1984.

scopecontent.p: 14 chapters on background facts and legislations for 14 environmental issues, plus intro & list of contributors

did.unittitle: Arnheim, Louise & Tryens, Jeffrey (Ed.). Legislative Sourcebook - Health Policy: Expanding Access to Care. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: 2 part book: PartI:Funding Mechanism. PartII: Basic Health Care Plans & Insurance Proposals.

did.unittitle: Peters, Farley (Compiled by). Taxes and Revenue: New Ideas for the Midwest - Agenda '85. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1984.

scopecontent.p: Chicago Illionois. 5 sections including legislation reviews and newspaper articles around categories of: "fiscal structures and policy considerations", "management and budget policies", "tax and revenue innovations", "tax policy and economic development", and "general"

did.unittitle: Davidoff, Linda & Williams, Cynthia (Prepared by). Executive Orders: A New Strategy to Use Public Agencies to Increase Voter Registration. Washington D.C.: Human Serve Fund, Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: 6 sections including intro, executive order strategy, texts of executive orders, implementation instructions to employees, key issues and list of contacts

did.unittitle: Arnheim, Louise & Webb, Lee (Ed.). A Health Care Agenda for the States. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: 7 sections including: intro, the health care crisis, health care for the elderly, health care financing & delivery, health care services, new approaches, health protection and list of contributors. (Note: Cover falling off)

did.unittitle: Webb, Lee (Compiled by). Bank Deregulation: New Ideas for Illinois. Springfield, Illinois. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1985.

scopecontent.p: Newspaper articles & policy reviews on the categories of "general", "consumers", "economic development", and "communities"

did.unittitle: Parker, Richard & Taylor, Tamsin. Strategic Investment: An Alternative for Public Funds. Studies in Pension Fund Investments 6. Washington D.C: Conference on Alternative & Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: 9 sections including changes in the investments climate, the common stock controversy, linked deposits, stategic investment policy, etc.

did.unittitle: Harrington, John C.. Packaging Housing Mortage Loan: Strategies for California. Studies in Pension Fund Investments 2. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative & Local Policies, 1979.

scopecontent.p: 5 sections of policy review including retirement & housing fund in CA, major findings, etc., plus appendices & bibliography

did.unittitle: Webb, Lee & Schweke, William (Ed.). Public Employee Pension Funds: New Strategies for Investment. Resources for Public Officials, Trade Unionists & Community Leaders. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1980.

scopecontent.p: 11 chapters including overview, public control of capital, pension fund investment, political & institutional obstacles, etc., plus glossary & resources

did.unittitle: Belden, Joe & Edwards, Gibby & Guyer, Cynthia & Webb, Lee (Ed.). New Directions in Farm, Land and Food Policies: A Time for State and Local Action. The Agriculture Project. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State & Local Policies, 1981.

scopecontent.p: 7 sections including strengthening the family farm, protecting farm land, conserving energy & natural resources, supporting low-income farmers, etc.

did.unittitle: Various authors. Southwest Regional Conference Report. Washington D.C.: Conference on Alternative State and Local Policies, 1975.

scopecontent.p: Pamphlet sent to conference participants. Summarizes the conference discussions, offers articles that apply to the conference.
